abstract: Layoffs, falling stock and slim dividends leave Pfizer little to cheer about one day after the $68 billion megamerger with Wyeth.
snippet: Layoffs, falling stock and slim dividends leave Pfizer little to cheer about one day after the $68 billion megamerger with Wyeth.
lead_paragraph: After announcing the $68 billion megamerger with Wyeth on Monday morning, Pfizer’s chief executive, Jeffrey B. Kindler, did not have much time to celebrate.

headline.main: For Pfizer, a Big Deal and a Test
headline.print_headline: For Pfizer, A Big Deal And a Test

abstract: Pfizer’s move to buy Wyeth dims the hopes of struggling small biotechnology companies that wanted to sell themselves or their products to larger businesses.
snippet: Pfizer’s move to buy Wyeth dims the hopes of struggling small biotechnology companies that wanted to sell themselves or their products to larger businesses.
lead_paragraph: This month Pfizer’s chief executive, Jeffrey B. Kindler, held a breakfast for venture capitalists atop a hotel in San Francisco. Some guests took it as a sign that Pfizer was serious about buying young biotechnology companies or licensing their technology.

headline.main: Wyeth Deal May Slow Pfizer Biotech Acquisitions
headline.print_headline: Purchase of Wyeth May Blunt Pfizer’s Appetite for Small Biotech Companies

headline.main: In Wyeth, Pfizer Sees a Drug Pipeline
